name: Church fathers-dev
tagline: Machine-corrected XML versions of a selection of Church Fathers.
body:
#Welcome to **church_fathers-dev**!

##About
This repository hosts digital versions of a selection of Church Fathers.

These XML files were produced by data entry company [Digital Divide Data](http://www.digitaldividedata.org/) (DDD), who corrected and encoded hOCR output generated by [Bruce Robertson](https://github.com/brobertson) in accordance with the latest [EpiDoc](http://sourceforge.net/p/epidoc/wiki/Home/) standards.
While adequate, more can and should be done to improve the XML (the -dev(elopment) suffix indicates the repository is open to improvement).

##Contents
* _[Chrysostom: De Sacerdotio](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/church_fathers-dev/blob/master/chrysostom_1906_de_sacerdotio.xml)_ (1906) ed. J. Arbuthnot Nairn. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
* _[Ecclesiasticus: The Greek Text of Codex 248](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/church_fathers-dev/blob/master/ecclesiasticus_1909.xml)_ (1909) ed. John Henry Arthur Hart. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
* Gregory of Nazianzus. _[The Five Theological Orations of Gregory of Nazianzus](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/church_fathers-dev/blob/master/gregoryNazianzus_1899.xml)_ (1899) ed. Arthur James Mason. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
* Pseudo Gregory of Nazianzus. _[Christus Patiens; Tragoedia Christiana, Quae Inscribi Solet Christos Pasxwn](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/church_fathers-dev/blob/master/christusPatiens_1885.xml)_ (1885) ed. Johann Georg Brambs. Lipsiae: In Aedibus B.G. Teubneri.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
